input.plot: Red crouches by the bunker’s keypad, her gloved fingers working quickly to bypass the security lock. She glances over her shoulder, scanning the shadowy dunes for movement. The air is sharp with ozone and the distant whir of servos. Suddenly, a heavy boot crunches on gravel behind her—Wolf, tall and broad-shouldered, steps from the gloom, face half-hidden beneath the visor of a battered security helmet. His synthetic voice emerges, clipped and official: 'You there, what’s your purpose at this facility?' Red straightens, keeping one hand tight on her satchel. She edges sideways, positioning herself between Wolf and the door. 'Just making a delivery,' she answers, her voice steady. Wolf advances, blocking the keypad with his body, scanning her with a handheld sensor. The device emits a sharp beep, and he narrows his eyes. Red’s other hand flicks a micro-jammer from her belt, thumbing the switch to disrupt the scanner’s signal. Wolf’s gaze sharpens, but he doesn’t move aside. The desert wind gusts, carrying the tang of oxidized metal and dust. Both remain locked in place, the bunker’s door hissing open behind Red as her bypass completes. Wolf reaches out, palm open, demanding, 'Show me your cargo authorization.' Red hesitates, then slips past him, ducking into the bunker’s dim corridor as alarms begin to pulse faintly in the distance, triggered by her override. The standoff ends with Red gaining entry—Wolf following, silent and relentless.

Red stands rigid on the polymer floor near the sealed starport bay, clutching the insulated delivery case to her chest. Mother, clad in a crisp, utilitarian jacket, strides toward her, data slate in hand, her eyes flicking between Red and the flickering wall displays that track outgoing shipments. Mother taps a sequence on her slate, unlocking the case, and reveals a vial of shimmering nanomedicine, then secures it again with a precise snap. She leans close, voice low: 'No diversions, Red. Straight to Outpost Eleven. Avoid Sector D—Wolf's drones are sweeping.' Red nods, adjusting her satchel and double-checking the charge on her prosthetic forearm. As a warning klaxon blares in the distance, Mother presses a comm bead into Red’s palm: 'For emergencies only.' Red tucks it away, her boots scraping against the dust-slick floor as she turns toward the mag-rail platform, the delivery case locked tight at her side. Mother watches her go, fingers tightening on the slate, already relaying security protocols to the nearby terminal.

Grandmother sits by her bedside tray, adjusting the nanomedicine injector and monitoring the outpost's internal sensors. She issues a precise voice command to the Security AI, instructing it to run an enhanced scan—specifically requesting a double-check of the west ridge and a detailed report within five minutes. The Security AI responds promptly, confirming the initiation of the scan and providing a real-time countdown. Grandmother reviews the telemetry, her expression intent and focused as she prepares for any potential threats on the outpost perimeter.

dialogue.speaker: Grandmother
dialogue.line: Security AI, initiate enhanced scan protocol. Double-check the west ridge—report in five minutes, no anomalies overlooked.

dialogue.speaker: Security AI
dialogue.line: Acknowledged. Enhanced scan protocol active. Scanning west ridge. Real-time countdown initiated: four minutes, fifty-five seconds.

dialogue.speaker: Red
dialogue.line: Grandma, do you see anything unusual? The telemetry’s spiking near the perimeter.

dialogue.speaker: Grandmother
dialogue.line: Nothing concrete yet, Red, but stay alert. If there’s trouble, we’ll be ready.

dialogue.speaker: Wolf
dialogue.line: They’re making it too easy. Security’s focused west—I’ll breach from the north. No witnesses.

dialogue.speaker: Officer Wolf
dialogue.line: All patrols, remain at posts. Confirm all access logs from the last hour—no exceptions.

dialogue.speaker: Mother
dialogue.line: Red, keep transmissions brief. We can’t risk interception. Prioritize delivery—your grandmother’s counting on you.

dialogue.speaker: Axel
dialogue.line: Copy, Mother. I’ll reroute the signal encryption—no one’s tracing us tonight.

dialogue.speaker: Rival Corporation Executives
dialogue.line: Our operatives report movement at the outpost. Accelerate extraction; the nanomedicine must be ours before dawn.

dialogue.speaker: Security AI
dialogue.line: Scan complete: three minutes remaining. No threats detected on west ridge. Continuing analysis.

input.plot: Red approaches the perimeter sensor pad, palming a forged courier badge as she scans for surveillance drones. The checkpoint’s scanner emits a high-pitched whine as she presses her thumb to the reader, her cybernetic fingers clicking. Officer Wolf steps from the glass booth, his security armor reflecting the lights, and blocks her path with a practiced motion. He requests her manifest and instructs her to place her satchel on the table for inspection. Red complies, keeping calm and cooperative, responding respectfully to his authority. Wolf notes that inspections have increased, mentioning this is already the second time this week, and asks if she has anything to declare. Red assures him everything is clean and in order. Satisfied with her responses, Wolf returns her data slate and allows her to proceed, warning her to keep her eyes open. Red tucks her satchel tighter and moves quickly toward the colony’s inner sectors, aware of Wolf’s gaze following her.

dialogue.speaker: Security AI
dialogue.line: Identity scan in progress. Please remain still.

dialogue.speaker: Red
dialogue.line: Of course. Here’s my badge and manifest, all in order.

dialogue.speaker: Officer Wolf
dialogue.line: Place your satchel on the table. Inspections have doubled lately—second time this week, you know.

dialogue.speaker: Red
dialogue.line: No trouble at all, officer. I understand the protocols.

dialogue.speaker: Officer Wolf
dialogue.line: Anything to declare today? You couriers tend to move fast and quiet.

dialogue.speaker: Red
dialogue.line: Just routine supplies—nothing outside regulations, sir.

dialogue.speaker: Officer Wolf
dialogue.line: Hmm. Everything checks out.

dialogue.speaker: Security AI
dialogue.line: Scan complete. No unauthorized materials detected.

dialogue.speaker: Officer Wolf
dialogue.line: Keep your eyes open. Things have been... unpredictable lately.

dialogue.speaker: Red
dialogue.line: I will, thank you. Have a safe shift.

dialogue.speaker: Officer Wolf
dialogue.line: Move along.

input.plot: Red moves swiftly through the underbrush, pulse pounding, as the search drones' beams sweep the forest. She works her tools, preparing to disrupt the security net, but is intercepted by Officer Wolf. Unlike a purely physical confrontation, Wolf blocks her path with authoritative intimidation, leveraging psychological pressure rather than immediate force. Their exchange is sharp—Wolf makes clear he knows Red’s intent and demands compliance, threatening escalation if she resists. Red, defiant and unwilling to submit, challenges Wolf’s authority, hinting at her determination to risk confrontation rather than surrender. The standoff is tense and verbal, with neither party escalating to violence yet, as Wolf issues warnings and Red stands her ground. Axel’s hack remains in progress, and as the network flickers, Red seizes a brief opening—using distraction rather than brute force—to slip past Wolf and into the deeper forest, her objective unchanged: deliver the nanomedicine to her grandmother. Wolf, frustrated but not physically bested, resumes pursuit, his resolve steeled by Red’s provocation.

dialogue.speaker: Red
dialogue.line: Stay back, Wolf. I’m not here to cause trouble—unless you force me.

dialogue.speaker: Officer Wolf
dialogue.line: You’re already in trouble, Red. I know exactly what’s in that satchel. Hand it over, and you walk away breathing.

dialogue.speaker: Red
dialogue.line: You don’t scare me. My grandmother needs this more than your employers need a bonus.

dialogue.speaker: Officer Wolf
dialogue.line: You’re risking more than your own life. Think carefully—resisting me will end badly for you.

dialogue.speaker: Red
dialogue.line: I’d rather risk everything than let you profit off someone else’s pain.

dialogue.speaker: Officer Wolf
dialogue.line: Defiance is wasted on me. I’ve seen braver souls break for less.

dialogue.speaker: Axel
dialogue.line: Red, now! The grid’s destabilizing—move while he’s distracted!

dialogue.speaker: Officer Wolf
dialogue.line: What—? Don’t even think about it!

dialogue.speaker: Red
dialogue.line: Sorry, Wolf. You’ll have to keep up.

dialogue.speaker: Officer Wolf
dialogue.line: This isn’t over, Red! I’ll hunt you through every shadow of this forest.

input.plot: Red crouches behind a battered cargo crate, her gloved fingers brushing grit from a comm-link as she patches into the outpost’s emergency channel. Grandmother’s voice crackles through the device, strained but urgent: 'Red, Wolf breached the secondary gate. You're in more danger than we thought. Lock the doors and stay hidden until I tell you it’s safe!' Grandmother’s tone grows desperate: 'Promise me you’ll never let him reach the nanomedicine, Red. If he gets his hands on it, the consequences could be catastrophic. That formula was never meant for someone like him. Please, stay safe.' Red’s jaw sets. She glances at the nanomedicine in her courier pack, feeling the weight of her promise to her Grandmother and the desperate hope of the colony. Despite Grandmother’s plea to hide, Red responds, her determination unwavering: 'This medicine is their only chance. I promised, and I don't break my word—no matter what it takes, I'll get it there.' She activates her cybernetic ocular filters, scanning for Wolf, and chooses the northern path, risking exposure but determined to deliver the cure.

dialogue.speaker: Grandmother
dialogue.line: Red, Wolf breached the secondary gate. You're in more danger than we thought. Lock the doors and stay hidden until I tell you it’s safe!

dialogue.speaker: Grandmother
dialogue.line: Promise me you’ll never let him reach the nanomedicine, Red. If he gets his hands on it, the consequences could be catastrophic. That formula was never meant for someone like him. Please, stay safe.

dialogue.speaker: Red
dialogue.line: I hear you, Gran, but hiding isn’t an option. The colony needs this cure more than I need safety.

dialogue.speaker: Red
dialogue.line: I promised you—I don’t break my word. No matter what, I’ll get it there.

dialogue.speaker: Mother
dialogue.line: Red, listen to your grandmother. The corridors aren’t secure—Wolf is dangerous, and we can’t risk losing the formula.

dialogue.speaker: Axel
dialogue.line: If you’re going north, ping me your route—I’ll jam the cams for five minutes tops. Just don’t get caught, okay?

dialogue.speaker: Wolf
dialogue.line: She thinks she can slip past me. Foolish. The pack always finds its prey.

dialogue.speaker: Officer Wolf
dialogue.line: Security breach acknowledged. Initiating lockdown protocols. All unauthorized personnel will be apprehended.

dialogue.speaker: Security AI
dialogue.line: Warning: Intruder detected at northern corridor. Defensive measures engaged.

dialogue.speaker: Rival Corporation Executives
dialogue.line: Monitor her progress. If Wolf fails, dispatch the second team—failure is unacceptable.
